ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The class discussions with the ambassador
I liked that it was a discussion, not a lecture, of topics that have an impact on current events.

Having the ambassador and practitioner in the classroom was a very valuable experience. It might not be the best academic/intellectual exercise but it did teach students about the real world - how a politician/lawyer/practitioner has to juggle through politics, science and survival.
The opportunity to analyze, research, and apply our learning to a relevant, real-world issue and (hopefully) make a difference.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This fits into my focus on international environmental policy and governance. I feel better equipped to discuss issues of climate change and the United Nations process, and feel legitimated as a Forester to engage with Law School students on this topic.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I had taken a good course with the professor before, and it sounded very high-minded.
My personal interest in the climate change negotiation process.
It provided a unique opportunity to interact with island representatives (the Ambassador and legal counselor)

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: My expectations were met and exceeded!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Group work split up the time required to work on a project. However, finding a common schedule was difficult for our members.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: It is awesome and you actually do something meaningful. Take it!
